00053 /* gcc 4.1 on mingw was complaining that __int64 was already defined
00054  * actually is saw the line below as typedef long long long long...
00055  * Anyhow, since its already defined, its safe to do an ifndef here- Campbell */
00056 #ifdef FREE_WINDOWS
00057 #  ifndef __int64
00058 typedef long long __int64;
00059 #  endif
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 /*
00063  * - please note: no builtin security to detect input of double structs
00064  * - if you want a struct not to be in DNA file: add two hash marks above it (#<enter>#<enter>)
00065  *
00066  * Structure DNA data is added to each blender file and to each executable, this to detect
00067  * in .blend files new veriables in structs, changed array sizes, etc. It's also used for
00068  * converting endian and pointer size (32-64 bits)
00069  * As an extra, Python uses a call to detect run-time the contents of a blender struct.
00070  *
00071  * Create a structDNA: only needed when one of the input include (.h) files change.
00072  * File Syntax:
00073  *     SDNA (4 bytes) (magic number)
00074  *     NAME (4 bytes)
00075  *     <nr> (4 bytes) amount of names (int)
00076  *     <string>
00077  *     <string>
00078  *     ...
00079  *     ...
00080  *     TYPE (4 bytes)
00081  *     <nr> amount of types (int)
00082  *     <string>
00083  *     <string>
00084  *     ...
00085  *     ...
00086  *     TLEN (4 bytes)
00087  *     <len> (short) the lengths of types
00088  *     <len>
00089  *     ...
00090  *     ...
00091  *     STRC (4 bytes)
00092  *     <nr> amount of structs (int)
00093  *     <typenr><nr_of_elems> <typenr><namenr> <typenr><namenr> ...
00094  *
00095  * !!Remember to read/write integer and short aligned!!
00096  *
00097  *  While writing a file, the names of a struct is indicated with a type number,
00098  *  to be found with: type= findstruct_nr(SDNA *, char *)
00099  *  The value of 'type' corresponds with the the index within the structs array
00100  *
00101  *  For the moment: the complete DNA file is included in a .blend file. For
00102  *  the future we can think of smarter methods, like only included the used
00103  *  structs. Only needed to keep a file short though...
00104  *
00105  * ALLOWED AND TESTED CHANGES IN STRUCTS:
00106  *  - type change (a char to float will be divided by 255)
00107  *  - location within a struct (everthing can be randomly mixed up)
00108  *  - struct within struct (within struct etc), this is recursive
00109  *  - adding new elements, will be default initialized zero
00110  *  - remving elements
00111  *  - change of array sizes
00112  *  - change of a pointer type: when the name doesn't change the contents is copied
00113  *
00114  * NOT YET:
00115  *  - array (vec[3]) to float struct (vec3f)
00116  *
00117  * DONE:
00118  *  - endian compatibility
00119  *  - pointer conversion (32-64 bits)
00120  *
00121  * IMPORTANT:
00122  *  - do not use #defines in structs for array lengths, this cannot be read by the dna functions
00123  *  - do not use uint, but unsigned int instead, ushort and ulong are allowed
00124  *  - only use a long in Blender if you want this to be the size of a pointer. so it is
00125  *    32 bits or 64 bits, dependent at the cpu architecture
00126  *  - chars are always unsigned
00127  *  - aligment of variables has to be done in such a way, that any system does
00128  *    not create 'padding' (gaps) in structures. So make sure that:
00129  *    - short: 2 aligned
00130  *    - int: 4 aligned
00131  *    - float: 4 aligned
00132  *    - double: 8 aligned
00133  *    - long: 8 aligned
00134  *    - struct: 8 aligned
00135  *  - the sdna functions have several error prints builtin, always check blender running from a console.
00136  *
00137  */
00138 
00139 /* local */
00140 static int le_int(int temp);
00141 static short le_short(short temp);
00142 
00143 /* ************************* ENDIAN STUFF ********************** */
00144 
00145 static short le_short(short temp)
00146 {
00147     short new;
00148     char *rt=(char *)&temp, *rtn=(char *)&new;
00149 
00150     rtn[0]= rt[1];
00151     rtn[1]= rt[0];
00152 
00153     return new;
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 static int le_int(int temp)
00158 {
00159     int new;
00160     char *rt=(char *)&temp, *rtn=(char *)&new;
00161 
00162     rtn[0]= rt[3];
00163     rtn[1]= rt[2];
00164     rtn[2]= rt[1];
00165     rtn[3]= rt[0];
00166 
00167     return new;
00168 }

00173 /* allowed duplicate code from makesdna.c */
00174 int DNA_elem_array_size(const char *astr, int len)
00175 {
00176     int a, mul=1;
00177     char str[100], *cp= NULL;
00178 
00179     memcpy(str, astr, len+1);
00180 
00181     for (a=0; a<len; a++) {
00182         if ( str[a]== '[' ) {
00183             cp= &(str[a+1]);
00184         }
00185         else if ( str[a]==']' && cp) {
00186             str[a]= 0;
00187             mul*= atoi(cp);
00188         }
00189     }
00190 
00191     return mul;
00192 }

00198 void DNA_sdna_free(SDNA *sdna)
00199 {
00200     MEM_freeN(sdna->data);
00201     MEM_freeN((void *)sdna->names);
00202     MEM_freeN(sdna->types);
00203     MEM_freeN(sdna->structs);
00204 
00205 #ifdef WITH_DNA_GHASH
00206     BLI_ghash_free(sdna->structs_map, NULL, NULL);
00207 #endif
00208 
00209     MEM_freeN(sdna);
00210 }

00212 static int ispointer(const char *name)
00213 {
00214     /* check if pointer or function pointer */
00215     return (name[0]=='*' || (name[0]=='(' && name[1]=='*'));
00216 }
00217 
00218 static int elementsize(SDNA *sdna, short type, short name)
00219 /* call with numbers from struct-array */
00220 {
00221     int mul, namelen, len;
00222     const char *cp;
00223     
00224     cp= sdna->names[name];
00225     len= 0;
00226     
00227     namelen= strlen(cp);
00228     /* is it a pointer or function pointer? */
00229     if (ispointer(cp)) {
00230         /* has the naam an extra length? (array) */
00231         mul= 1;
00232         if ( cp[namelen-1]==']') mul= DNA_elem_array_size(cp, namelen);
00233         
00234         len= sdna->pointerlen*mul;
00235     }
00236     else if ( sdna->typelens[type] ) {
00237         /* has the naam an extra length? (array) */
00238         mul= 1;
00239         if ( cp[namelen-1]==']') mul= DNA_elem_array_size(cp, namelen);
00240         
00241         len= mul*sdna->typelens[type];
00242         
00243     }
00244     
00245     return len;
00246 }

00267 static short *findstruct_name(SDNA *sdna, const char *str)
00268 {
00269     int a;
00270     short *sp= NULL;
00271 
00272 
00273     for (a=0; a<sdna->nr_structs; a++) {
00274 
00275         sp= sdna->structs[a];
00276         
00277         if (strcmp( sdna->types[ sp[0] ], str )==0) return sp;
00278     }
00279     
00280     return NULL;
00281 }
00282 
00283 int DNA_struct_find_nr(SDNA *sdna, const char *str)
00284 {
00285     short *sp= NULL;
00286 
00287     if (sdna->lastfind<sdna->nr_structs) {
00288         sp= sdna->structs[sdna->lastfind];
00289         if (strcmp( sdna->types[ sp[0] ], str )==0) return sdna->lastfind;
00290     }
00291 
00292 #ifdef WITH_DNA_GHASH
00293     return (intptr_t)BLI_ghash_lookup(sdna->structs_map, str) - 1;
00294 #else
00295     {
00296         int a;
00297 
00298         for (a=0; a<sdna->nr_structs; a++) {
00299 
00300             sp= sdna->structs[a];
00301 
00302             if (strcmp( sdna->types[ sp[0] ], str )==0) {
00303                 sdna->lastfind= a;
00304                 return a;
00305             }
00306         }
00307     }
00308     return -1;
00309 #endif
00310 }

00314 /* ************************* READ DNA ********************** */
00315 
00316 static void init_structDNA(SDNA *sdna, int do_endian_swap)
00317 /* in sdna->data the data, now we convert that to something understandable */
00318 {
00319     int *data, *verg, gravity_fix= -1;
00320     intptr_t nr;
00321     short *sp;
00322     char str[8], *cp;
00323     
00324     verg= (int *)str;
00325     data= (int *)sdna->data;
00326 
00327     strcpy(str, "SDNA");
00328     if ( *data == *verg ) {
00329     
00330         data++;
00331         
00332         /* load names array */
00333         strcpy(str, "NAME");
00334         if ( *data == *verg ) {
00335             data++;
00336             
00337             if (do_endian_swap) sdna->nr_names= le_int(*data);
00338             else sdna->nr_names= *data;
00339             
00340             data++;
00341             sdna->names= MEM_callocN( sizeof(void *)*sdna->nr_names, "sdnanames");
00342         }
00343         else {
00344             printf("NAME error in SDNA file\n");
00345             return;
00346         }
00347         
00348         nr= 0;
00349         cp= (char *)data;
00350         while (nr<sdna->nr_names) {
00351             sdna->names[nr]= cp;
00352 
00353             /* "float gravity [3]" was parsed wrong giving both "gravity" and
00354              * "[3]"  members. we rename "[3]", and later set the type of
00355              * "gravity" to "void" so the offsets work out correct */
00356             if (*cp == '[' && strcmp(cp, "[3]")==0) {
00357                 if (nr && strcmp(sdna->names[nr-1], "Cvi") == 0) {
00358                     sdna->names[nr]= "gravity[3]";
00359                     gravity_fix= nr;
00360                 }
00361             }
00362 
00363             while ( *cp) cp++;
00364             cp++;
00365             nr++;
00366         }
00367         nr= (intptr_t)cp;       /* prevent BUS error */
00368         nr= (nr+3) & ~3;
00369         cp= (char *)nr;
00370         
00371         /* load type names array */
00372         data= (int *)cp;
00373         strcpy(str, "TYPE");
00374         if ( *data == *verg ) {
00375             data++;
00376             
00377             if (do_endian_swap) sdna->nr_types= le_int(*data);
00378             else sdna->nr_types= *data;
00379             
00380             data++;
00381             sdna->types= MEM_callocN( sizeof(void *)*sdna->nr_types, "sdnatypes");
00382         }
00383         else {
00384             printf("TYPE error in SDNA file\n");
00385             return;
00386         }
00387         
00388         nr= 0;
00389         cp= (char *)data;
00390         while (nr<sdna->nr_types) {
00391             sdna->types[nr]= cp;
00392             
00393             /* this is a patch, to change struct names without a conflict with SDNA */
00394             /* be careful to use it, in this case for a system-struct (opengl/X) */
00395             
00396             if ( *cp == 'b') {
00397                 /* struct Screen was already used by X, 'bScreen' replaces the old IrisGL 'Screen' struct */
00398                 if ( strcmp("bScreen", cp)==0 ) sdna->types[nr]= cp+1;
00399             }
00400             
00401             while ( *cp) cp++;
00402             cp++;
00403             nr++;
00404         }
00405         nr= (intptr_t)cp;       /* prevent BUS error */
00406         nr= (nr+3) & ~3;
00407         cp= (char *)nr;
00408         
00409         /* load typelen array */
00410         data= (int *)cp;
00411         strcpy(str, "TLEN");
00412         if ( *data == *verg ) {
00413             data++;
00414             sp= (short *)data;
00415             sdna->typelens= sp;
00416             
00417             if (do_endian_swap) {
00418                 short a, *spo= sp;
00419                 
00420                 a= sdna->nr_types;
00421                 while (a--) {
00422                     spo[0]= le_short(spo[0]);
00423                     spo++;
00424                 }
00425             }
00426             
00427             sp+= sdna->nr_types;
00428         }
00429         else {
00430             printf("TLEN error in SDNA file\n");
00431             return;
00432         }
00433         if (sdna->nr_types & 1) sp++;   /* prevent BUS error */
00434 
00435         /* load struct array */
00436         data= (int *)sp;
00437         strcpy(str, "STRC");
00438         if ( *data == *verg ) {
00439             data++;
00440             
00441             if (do_endian_swap) sdna->nr_structs= le_int(*data);
00442             else sdna->nr_structs= *data;
00443             
00444             data++;
00445             sdna->structs= MEM_callocN( sizeof(void *)*sdna->nr_structs, "sdnastrcs");
00446         }
00447         else {
00448             printf("STRC error in SDNA file\n");
00449             return;
00450         }
00451         
00452         nr= 0;
00453         sp= (short *)data;
00454         while (nr<sdna->nr_structs) {
00455             sdna->structs[nr]= sp;
00456             
00457             if (do_endian_swap) {
00458                 short a;
00459                 
00460                 sp[0]= le_short(sp[0]);
00461                 sp[1]= le_short(sp[1]);
00462                 
00463                 a= sp[1];
00464                 sp+= 2;
00465                 while (a--) {
00466                     sp[0]= le_short(sp[0]);
00467                     sp[1]= le_short(sp[1]);
00468                     sp+= 2;
00469                 }
00470             }
00471             else {
00472                 sp+= 2*sp[1]+2;
00473             }
00474             
00475             nr++;
00476         }
00477 
00478         /* finally pointerlen: use struct ListBase to test it, never change the size of it! */
00479         sp= findstruct_name(sdna, "ListBase");
00480         /* weird; i have no memory of that... I think I used sizeof(void *) before... (ton) */
00481         
00482         sdna->pointerlen= sdna->typelens[ sp[0] ]/2;
00483 
00484         if (sp[1]!=2 || (sdna->pointerlen!=4 && sdna->pointerlen!=8)) {
00485             printf("ListBase struct error! Needs it to calculate pointerize.\n");
00486             exit(0);
00487             /* well, at least sizeof(ListBase) is error proof! (ton) */
00488         }
00489         
00490         /* second part of gravity problem, setting "gravity" type to void */
00491         if (gravity_fix > -1) {
00492             for (nr=0; nr<sdna->nr_structs; nr++) {
00493                 sp= sdna->structs[nr];
00494                 if (strcmp(sdna->types[sp[0]], "ClothSimSettings") == 0)
00495                     sp[10]= SDNA_TYPE_VOID;
00496             }
00497         }
00498 
00499 #ifdef WITH_DNA_GHASH
00500         /* create a ghash lookup to speed up */
00501         sdna->structs_map= BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_strhash, BLI_ghashutil_strcmp, "init_structDNA gh");
00502 
00503         for (nr = 0; nr < sdna->nr_structs; nr++) {
00504             sp= sdna->structs[nr];
00505             BLI_ghash_insert(sdna->structs_map, (void *)sdna->types[sp[0]], (void *)(nr + 1));
00506         }
00507 #endif
00508     }
00509 }
00510 
00511 SDNA *DNA_sdna_from_data(void *data, int datalen, int do_endian_swap)
00512 {
00513     SDNA *sdna= MEM_mallocN(sizeof(*sdna), "sdna");
00514     
00515     sdna->lastfind= 0;
00516 
00517     sdna->datalen= datalen;
00518     sdna->data= MEM_mallocN(datalen, "sdna_data");
00519     memcpy(sdna->data, data, datalen);
00520     
00521     init_structDNA(sdna, do_endian_swap);
00522     
00523     return sdna;
00524 }

00528 /* ******************* HANDLE DNA ***************** */
00529 
00530 static void recurs_test_compflags(SDNA *sdna, char *compflags, int structnr)
00531 {
00532     int a, b, typenr, elems;
00533     short *sp;
00534     const char *cp;
00535     
00536     /* check all structs, test if it's inside another struct */
00537     sp= sdna->structs[structnr];
00538     typenr= sp[0];
00539     
00540     for (a=0; a<sdna->nr_structs; a++) {
00541         if (a!=structnr && compflags[a]==1) {
00542             sp= sdna->structs[a];
00543             elems= sp[1];
00544             sp+= 2;
00545             for (b=0; b<elems; b++, sp+=2) {
00546                 if (sp[0]==typenr) {
00547                     cp= sdna->names[ sp[1] ];
00548                     if (!ispointer(cp)) {
00549                         compflags[a]= 2;
00550                         recurs_test_compflags(sdna, compflags, a);
00551                     }
00552                 }
00553             }
00554         }
00555     }
00556     
00557 }
00558 
00559     /* Unsure of exact function - compares the sdna argument to
00560      * newsdna and sets up the information necessary to convert
00561      * data written with a dna of oldsdna to inmemory data with a
00562      * structure defined by the newsdna sdna (I think). -zr
00563      */
00564 
00565 /* well, the function below is just a lookup table to speed
00566  * up reading files. doh! -ton
00567  */
00568 
00569 
00570 char *DNA_struct_get_compareflags(SDNA *sdna, SDNA *newsdna)
00571 {
00572     /* flag: 0: doesn't exist anymore (or not yet)
00573      *       1: is equal
00574      *       2: is different
00575      */
00576     int a, b;
00577     short *spold, *spcur;
00578     const char *str1, *str2;
00579     char *compflags;
00580     
00581     if (sdna->nr_structs==0) {
00582         printf("error: file without SDNA\n");
00583         return NULL;
00584     }
00585         
00586     compflags= MEM_callocN(sdna->nr_structs, "compflags");
00587 
00588     /* we check all structs in 'sdna' and compare them with 
00589      * the structs in 'newsdna'
00590      */
00591     
00592     for (a=0; a<sdna->nr_structs; a++) {
00593         spold= sdna->structs[a];
00594         
00595         /* search for type in cur */
00596         spcur= findstruct_name(newsdna, sdna->types[spold[0]]);
00597         
00598         if (spcur) {
00599             compflags[a]= 2;
00600             
00601             /* compare length and amount of elems */
00602             if ( spcur[1] == spold[1]) {
00603                 if ( newsdna->typelens[spcur[0]] == sdna->typelens[spold[0]] ) {
00604 
00605                     /* same length, same amount of elems, now per type and name */
00606                     b= spold[1];
00607                     spold+= 2;
00608                     spcur+= 2;
00609                     while (b > 0) {
00610                         str1= newsdna->types[spcur[0]];
00611                         str2= sdna->types[spold[0]];
00612                         if (strcmp(str1, str2)!=0) break;
00613 
00614                         str1= newsdna->names[spcur[1]];
00615                         str2= sdna->names[spold[1]];
00616                         if (strcmp(str1, str2)!=0) break;
00617 
00618                         /* same type and same name, now pointersize */
00619                         if (ispointer(str1)) {
00620                             if (sdna->pointerlen!=newsdna->pointerlen) break;
00621                         }
00622 
00623                         b--;
00624                         spold+= 2;
00625                         spcur+= 2;
00626                     }
00627                     if (b==0) compflags[a]= 1;
00628 
00629                 }
00630             }
00631             
00632         }
00633     }
00634 
00635     /* first struct in util.h is struct Link, this is skipped in compflags (als # 0).
00636      * was a bug, and this way dirty patched! Solve this later....
00637      */
00638     compflags[0]= 1;
00639 
00640     /* Because structs can be inside structs, we recursively
00641      * set flags when a struct is altered
00642      */
00643     for (a=0; a<sdna->nr_structs; a++) {
00644         if (compflags[a]==2) recurs_test_compflags(sdna, compflags, a);
00645     }
00646     
00647 #if 0
00648     for (a=0; a<sdna->nr_structs; a++) {
00649         if (compflags[a]==2) {
00650             spold= sdna->structs[a];
00651             printf("changed: %s\n", sdna->types[ spold[0] ]);
00652         }
00653     }
00654 #endif
00655 
00656     return compflags;
00657 }
00658 
00659 static eSDNA_Type sdna_type_nr(const char *dna_type)
00660 {
00661     if     ((strcmp(dna_type, "char")==0) || (strcmp(dna_type, "const char")==0))         return SDNA_TYPE_CHAR;
00662     else if ((strcmp(dna_type, "uchar")==0) || (strcmp(dna_type, "unsigned char")==0))     return SDNA_TYPE_UCHAR;
00663     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "short")==0)                                                return SDNA_TYPE_SHORT;
00664     else if ((strcmp(dna_type, "ushort")==0)||(strcmp(dna_type, "unsigned short")==0))     return SDNA_TYPE_USHORT;
00665     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "int")==0)                                                  return SDNA_TYPE_INT;
00666     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "long")==0)                                                 return SDNA_TYPE_LONG;
00667     else if ((strcmp(dna_type, "ulong")==0)||(strcmp(dna_type, "unsigned long")==0))       return SDNA_TYPE_ULONG;
00668     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "float")==0)                                                return SDNA_TYPE_FLOAT;
00669     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "double")==0)                                               return SDNA_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00670     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "int64_t")==0)                                              return SDNA_TYPE_INT64;
00671     else if ( strcmp(dna_type, "uint64_t")==0)                                             return SDNA_TYPE_UINT64;
00672     else                                                                                  return -1; /* invalid! */
00673 }
00674 
00675 static void cast_elem(const char *ctype, const char *otype, const char *name, char *curdata, char *olddata)
00676 {
00677     double val = 0.0;
00678     int arrlen, curlen=1, oldlen=1;
00679 
00680     eSDNA_Type ctypenr, otypenr;
00681 
00682     arrlen= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
00683 
00684     if ( (otypenr= sdna_type_nr(otype)) == -1 ||
00685          (ctypenr= sdna_type_nr(ctype)) == -1 )
00686     {
00687         return;
00688     }
00689 
00690     /* define lengths */
00691     oldlen= DNA_elem_type_size(otypenr);
00692     curlen= DNA_elem_type_size(ctypenr);
00693 
00694     while (arrlen>0) {
00695         switch(otypenr) {
00696         case SDNA_TYPE_CHAR:
00697             val= *olddata; break;
00698         case SDNA_TYPE_UCHAR:
00699             val= *( (unsigned char *)olddata); break;
00700         case SDNA_TYPE_SHORT:
00701             val= *( (short *)olddata); break;
00702         case SDNA_TYPE_USHORT:
00703             val= *( (unsigned short *)olddata); break;
00704         case SDNA_TYPE_INT:
00705             val= *( (int *)olddata); break;
00706         case SDNA_TYPE_LONG:
00707             val= *( (int *)olddata); break;
00708         case SDNA_TYPE_ULONG:
00709             val= *( (unsigned int *)olddata); break;
00710         case SDNA_TYPE_FLOAT:
00711             val= *( (float *)olddata); break;
00712         case SDNA_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00713             val= *( (double *)olddata); break;
00714         case SDNA_TYPE_INT64:
00715             val= *( (int64_t *)olddata); break;
00716         case SDNA_TYPE_UINT64:
00717             val= *( (uint64_t *)olddata); break;
00718         }
00719         
00720         switch(ctypenr) {
00721         case SDNA_TYPE_CHAR:
00722             *curdata= val; break;
00723         case SDNA_TYPE_UCHAR:
00724             *( (unsigned char *)curdata)= val; break;
00725         case SDNA_TYPE_SHORT:
00726             *( (short *)curdata)= val; break;
00727         case SDNA_TYPE_USHORT:
00728             *( (unsigned short *)curdata)= val; break;
00729         case SDNA_TYPE_INT:
00730             *( (int *)curdata)= val; break;
00731         case SDNA_TYPE_LONG:
00732             *( (int *)curdata)= val; break;
00733         case SDNA_TYPE_ULONG:
00734             *( (unsigned int *)curdata)= val; break;
00735         case SDNA_TYPE_FLOAT:
00736             if (otypenr<2) val/= 255;
00737             *( (float *)curdata)= val; break;
00738         case SDNA_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00739             if (otypenr<2) val/= 255;
00740             *( (double *)curdata)= val; break;
00741         case SDNA_TYPE_INT64:
00742             *( (int64_t *)curdata)= val; break;
00743         case SDNA_TYPE_UINT64:
00744             *( (uint64_t *)curdata)= val; break;
00745         }
00746 
00747         olddata+= oldlen;
00748         curdata+= curlen;
00749         arrlen--;
00750     }
00751 }
00752 
00753 static void cast_pointer(int curlen, int oldlen, const char *name, char *curdata, char *olddata)
00754 {
00755 #ifdef WIN32
00756     __int64 lval;
00757 #else
00758     long long lval;
00759 #endif
00760     int arrlen;
00761     
00762     arrlen= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
00763     
00764     while (arrlen>0) {
00765     
00766         if (curlen==oldlen) {
00767             memcpy(curdata, olddata, curlen);
00768         }
00769         else if (curlen==4 && oldlen==8) {
00770 #ifdef WIN32            
00771             lval= *( (__int64 *)olddata );
00772 #else
00773             lval= *( (long long *)olddata );
00774 #endif
00775             *((int *)curdata) = lval>>3;        /* is of course gambling! */
00776         }
00777         else if (curlen==8 && oldlen==4) {
00778 #ifdef WIN32
00779              *( (__int64 *)curdata ) = *((int *)olddata);
00780 #else
00781              *( (long long *)curdata ) = *((int *)olddata);
00782 #endif
00783         }
00784         else {
00785             /* for debug */
00786             printf("errpr: illegal pointersize!\n");
00787         }
00788         
00789         olddata+= oldlen;
00790         curdata+= curlen;
00791         arrlen--;
00792 
00793     }
00794 }
00795 
00796 static int elem_strcmp(const char *name, const char *oname)
00797 {
00798     int a=0;
00799     
00800     /* strcmp without array part */
00801     
00802     while (1) {
00803         if (name[a] != oname[a]) return 1;
00804         if (name[a]=='[') break;
00805         if (name[a]==0) break;
00806         a++;
00807     }
00808     return 0;
00809 }
00810 
00811 static char *find_elem(SDNA *sdna, const char *type, const char *name, short *old, char *olddata, short **sppo)
00812 {
00813     int a, elemcount, len;
00814     const char *otype, *oname;
00815     
00816     /* without arraypart, so names can differ: return old namenr and type */
00817     
00818     /* in old is the old struct */
00819     elemcount= old[1];
00820     old+= 2;
00821     for (a=0; a<elemcount; a++, old+=2) {
00822     
00823         otype= sdna->types[old[0]];
00824         oname= sdna->names[old[1]];
00825         
00826         len= elementsize(sdna, old[0], old[1]);
00827         
00828         if ( elem_strcmp(name, oname)==0 ) {    /* naam equal */
00829             if ( strcmp(type, otype)==0 ) { /* type equal */
00830                 if (sppo) *sppo= old;
00831                 return olddata;
00832             }
00833             
00834             return NULL;
00835         }
00836         
00837         olddata+= len;
00838     }
00839     return NULL;
00840 }
00841 
00842 static void reconstruct_elem(SDNA *newsdna, SDNA *oldsdna,
00843                              char *type, const char *name, char *curdata, short *old, char *olddata)
00844 {
00845     /* rules: test for NAME:
00846      *      - name equal:
00847      *          - cast type
00848      *      - name partially equal (array differs)
00849      *          - type equal: memcpy
00850      *          - types casten
00851      * (nzc 2-4-2001 I want the 'unsigned' bit to be parsed as well. Where
00852      * can I force this?)
00853      */
00854     int a, elemcount, len, array, oldsize, cursize, mul;
00855     char *otype;
00856     const char *oname, *cp;
00857     
00858     /* is 'name' an array? */
00859     cp= name;
00860     array= 0;
00861     while ( *cp && *cp!='[') {
00862         cp++; array++;
00863     }
00864     if ( *cp!= '[' ) array= 0;
00865     
00866     /* in old is the old struct */
00867     elemcount= old[1];
00868     old+= 2;
00869     for (a=0; a<elemcount; a++, old+=2) {
00870         otype= oldsdna->types[old[0]];
00871         oname= oldsdna->names[old[1]];
00872         len= elementsize(oldsdna, old[0], old[1]);
00873         
00874         if ( strcmp(name, oname)==0 ) { /* name equal */
00875             
00876             if (ispointer(name)) {  /* pointer of functionpointer afhandelen */
00877                 cast_pointer(newsdna->pointerlen, oldsdna->pointerlen, name, curdata, olddata);
00878             }
00879             else if ( strcmp(type, otype)==0 ) {    /* type equal */
00880                 memcpy(curdata, olddata, len);
00881             }
00882             else cast_elem(type, otype, name, curdata, olddata);
00883 
00884             return;
00885         }
00886         else if (array) {       /* name is an array */
00887 
00888             if (oname[array]=='[' && strncmp(name, oname, array)==0 ) {         /* basis equal */
00889                 
00890                 cursize= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
00891                 oldsize= DNA_elem_array_size(oname, strlen(oname));
00892 
00893                 if (ispointer(name)) {      /* handle pointer or functionpointer */
00894                     if (cursize>oldsize) cast_pointer(newsdna->pointerlen, oldsdna->pointerlen, oname, curdata, olddata);
00895                     else cast_pointer(newsdna->pointerlen, oldsdna->pointerlen, name, curdata, olddata);
00896                 }
00897                 else if (name[0]=='*' || strcmp(type, otype)==0 ) { /* type equal */
00898                     mul= len/oldsize;
00899                     mul*= (cursize < oldsize)? cursize: oldsize;
00900                     memcpy(curdata, olddata, mul);
00901                     
00902                     /* terminate strings */
00903                     if (oldsize > cursize && strcmp(type, "char")==0)
00904                         curdata[mul-1]= 0;
00905                 }
00906                 else {
00907                     if (cursize>oldsize) cast_elem(type, otype, oname, curdata, olddata);
00908                     else cast_elem(type, otype, name, curdata, olddata);
00909                 }
00910                 return;
00911             }
00912         }
00913         olddata+= len;
00914     }
00915 }
00916 
00917 static void reconstruct_struct(SDNA *newsdna, SDNA *oldsdna,
00918                                char *compflags, int oldSDNAnr, char *data, int curSDNAnr, char *cur)
00919 {
00920     /* Recursive!
00921      * Per element from cur_struct, read data from old_struct.
00922      * If element is a struct, call recursive.
00923      */
00924     int a, elemcount, elen, eleno, mul, mulo, firststructtypenr;
00925     short *spo, *spc, *sppo;
00926     char *type, *cpo, *cpc;
00927     const char *name, *nameo;
00928 
00929     if (oldSDNAnr== -1) return;
00930     if (curSDNAnr== -1) return;
00931 
00932     if ( compflags[oldSDNAnr]==1 ) {        /* if recursive: test for equal */
00933     
00934         spo= oldsdna->structs[oldSDNAnr];
00935         elen= oldsdna->typelens[ spo[0] ];
00936         memcpy( cur, data, elen);
00937         
00938         return;
00939     }
00940 
00941     firststructtypenr= *(newsdna->structs[0]);
00942 
00943     spo= oldsdna->structs[oldSDNAnr];
00944     spc= newsdna->structs[curSDNAnr];
00945 
00946     elemcount= spc[1];
00947 
00948     spc+= 2;
00949     cpc= cur;
00950     for (a=0; a<elemcount; a++, spc+=2) {
00951         type= newsdna->types[spc[0]];
00952         name= newsdna->names[spc[1]];
00953         
00954         elen= elementsize(newsdna, spc[0], spc[1]);
00955 
00956         /* test: is type a struct? */
00957         if (spc[0]>=firststructtypenr  &&  !ispointer(name)) {
00958         
00959             /* where does the old struct data start (and is there an old one?) */
00960             cpo= find_elem(oldsdna, type, name, spo, data, &sppo);
00961             
00962             if (cpo) {
00963                 oldSDNAnr= DNA_struct_find_nr(oldsdna, type);
00964                 curSDNAnr= DNA_struct_find_nr(newsdna, type);
00965                 
00966                 /* array! */
00967                 mul= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
00968                 nameo= oldsdna->names[sppo[1]];
00969                 mulo= DNA_elem_array_size(nameo, strlen(nameo));
00970                 
00971                 eleno= elementsize(oldsdna, sppo[0], sppo[1]);
00972                 
00973                 elen/= mul;
00974                 eleno/= mulo;
00975                 
00976                 while (mul--) {
00977                     reconstruct_struct(newsdna, oldsdna, compflags, oldSDNAnr, cpo, curSDNAnr, cpc);
00978                     cpo+= eleno;
00979                     cpc+= elen;
00980                     
00981                     /* new struct array larger than old */
00982                     mulo--;
00983                     if (mulo<=0) break;
00984                 }
00985             }
00986             else cpc+= elen;
00987         }
00988         else {
00989 
00990             reconstruct_elem(newsdna, oldsdna, type, name, cpc, spo, data);
00991             cpc+= elen;
00992 
00993         }
00994     }
00995 }
00996 
00997 void DNA_struct_switch_endian(SDNA *oldsdna, int oldSDNAnr, char *data)
00998 {
00999     /* Recursive!
01000      * If element is a struct, call recursive.
01001      */
01002     int a, mul, elemcount, elen, elena, firststructtypenr;
01003     short *spo, *spc, skip;
01004     char *type, *cpo, *cur, cval;
01005     const char *name;
01006 
01007     if (oldSDNAnr== -1) return;
01008     firststructtypenr= *(oldsdna->structs[0]);
01009     
01010     spo= spc= oldsdna->structs[oldSDNAnr];
01011 
01012     elemcount= spo[1];
01013 
01014     spc+= 2;
01015     cur= data;
01016     
01017     for (a=0; a<elemcount; a++, spc+=2) {
01018         type= oldsdna->types[spc[0]];
01019         name= oldsdna->names[spc[1]];
01020         
01021         /* elementsize = including arraysize */
01022         elen= elementsize(oldsdna, spc[0], spc[1]);
01023 
01024         /* test: is type a struct? */
01025         if (spc[0]>=firststructtypenr  &&  !ispointer(name)) {
01026             /* where does the old data start (is there one?) */
01027             cpo= find_elem(oldsdna, type, name, spo, data, NULL);
01028             if (cpo) {
01029                 oldSDNAnr= DNA_struct_find_nr(oldsdna, type);
01030                 
01031                 mul= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
01032                 elena= elen/mul;
01033 
01034                 while (mul--) {
01035                     DNA_struct_switch_endian(oldsdna, oldSDNAnr, cpo);
01036                     cpo += elena;
01037                 }
01038             }
01039         }
01040         else {
01041             
01042             if (ispointer(name)) {
01043                 if (oldsdna->pointerlen==8) {
01044                     
01045                     mul= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
01046                     cpo= cur;
01047                     while (mul--) {
01048                         cval= cpo[0]; cpo[0]= cpo[7]; cpo[7]= cval;
01049                         cval= cpo[1]; cpo[1]= cpo[6]; cpo[6]= cval;
01050                         cval= cpo[2]; cpo[2]= cpo[5]; cpo[5]= cval;
01051                         cval= cpo[3]; cpo[3]= cpo[4]; cpo[4]= cval;
01052                         
01053                         cpo+= 8;
01054                     }
01055                     
01056                 }
01057             }
01058             else {
01059                 
01060                 if ( spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_SHORT ||
01061                      spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_USHORT )
01062                 {
01063                     
01064                     /* exception: variable called blocktype/ipowin: derived from ID_  */
01065                     skip= 0;
01066                     if (name[0]=='b' && name[1]=='l') {
01067                         if (strcmp(name, "blocktype")==0) skip= 1;
01068                     }
01069                     else if (name[0]=='i' && name[1]=='p') {
01070                         if (strcmp(name, "ipowin")==0) skip= 1;
01071                     }
01072                     
01073                     if (skip==0) {
01074                         mul= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
01075                         cpo= cur;
01076                         while (mul--) {
01077                             cval= cpo[0];
01078                             cpo[0]= cpo[1];
01079                             cpo[1]= cval;
01080                             cpo+= 2;
01081                         }
01082                     }
01083                 }
01084                 else if ( (spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_INT    ||
01085                            spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_LONG   ||
01086                            spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_ULONG  ||
01087                            spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_FLOAT))
01088                 {
01089 
01090                     mul= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
01091                     cpo= cur;
01092                     while (mul--) {
01093                         cval= cpo[0];
01094                         cpo[0]= cpo[3];
01095                         cpo[3]= cval;
01096                         cval= cpo[1];
01097                         cpo[1]= cpo[2];
01098                         cpo[2]= cval;
01099                         cpo+= 4;
01100                     }
01101                 }
01102                 else if ( (spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_INT64) ||
01103                           (spc[0]==SDNA_TYPE_UINT64))
01104                 {
01105                     mul= DNA_elem_array_size(name, strlen(name));
01106                     cpo= cur;
01107                     while (mul--) {
01108                         cval= cpo[0]; cpo[0]= cpo[7]; cpo[7]= cval;
01109                         cval= cpo[1]; cpo[1]= cpo[6]; cpo[6]= cval;
01110                         cval= cpo[2]; cpo[2]= cpo[5]; cpo[5]= cval;
01111                         cval= cpo[3]; cpo[3]= cpo[4]; cpo[4]= cval;
01112 
01113                         cpo+= 8;
01114                     }
01115                 }
01116             }
01117         }
01118         cur+= elen;
01119     }
01120 }
01121 
01122 void *DNA_struct_reconstruct(SDNA *newsdna, SDNA *oldsdna, char *compflags, int oldSDNAnr, int blocks, void *data)
01123 {
01124     int a, curSDNAnr, curlen=0, oldlen;
01125     short *spo, *spc;
01126     char *cur, *type, *cpc, *cpo;
01127     
01128     /* oldSDNAnr == structnr, we're looking for the corresponding 'cur' number */
01129     spo= oldsdna->structs[oldSDNAnr];
01130     type= oldsdna->types[ spo[0] ];
01131     oldlen= oldsdna->typelens[ spo[0] ];
01132     curSDNAnr= DNA_struct_find_nr(newsdna, type);
01133 
01134     /* init data and alloc */
01135     if (curSDNAnr >= 0) {
01136         spc= newsdna->structs[curSDNAnr];
01137         curlen= newsdna->typelens[ spc[0] ];
01138     }
01139     if (curlen==0) {
01140         return NULL;
01141     }
01142 
01143     cur= MEM_callocN( blocks*curlen, "reconstruct");
01144     cpc= cur;
01145     cpo= data;
01146     for (a=0; a<blocks; a++) {
01147         reconstruct_struct(newsdna, oldsdna, compflags, oldSDNAnr, cpo, curSDNAnr, cpc);
01148         cpc+= curlen;
01149         cpo+= oldlen;
01150     }
01151 
01152     return cur;
01153 }
01154 
01155 int DNA_elem_offset(SDNA *sdna, const char *stype, const char *vartype, const char *name)
01156 {
01157     
01158     int SDNAnr= DNA_struct_find_nr(sdna, stype);
01159     short *spo= sdna->structs[SDNAnr];
01160     char *cp= find_elem(sdna, vartype, name, spo, NULL, NULL);
01161     return (int)((intptr_t)cp);
01162 }
01163 
01164 int DNA_elem_type_size(const eSDNA_Type elem_nr)
01165 {
01166     /* should containt all enum types */
01167     switch (elem_nr) {
01168         case SDNA_TYPE_CHAR:
01169         case SDNA_TYPE_UCHAR:
01170             return 1;
01171         case SDNA_TYPE_SHORT:
01172         case SDNA_TYPE_USHORT:
01173             return 2;
01174         case SDNA_TYPE_INT:
01175         case SDNA_TYPE_LONG:
01176         case SDNA_TYPE_ULONG:
01177         case SDNA_TYPE_FLOAT:
01178             return 4;
01179         case SDNA_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01180         case SDNA_TYPE_INT64:
01181         case SDNA_TYPE_UINT64:
01182             return 8;
01183     }
01184 
01185     /* weak */
01186     return 8;
01187 }
